post_text:
We continue to plan for the upcoming school year and we are beginning to delve into the finer details. Decision points thus far: 1) We will begin the school year in a hybrid model (2 days in-person & 3 days remote for a regular five day week). Current capacity guidelines will limit us to around 50%, which will mean 2 grades in the building/day. 2) We will operate in a 4x4 block style for this school year. Four classes per half-year. Note: The guidance department has almost completed the upload of the revamped class schedule into the system...Expect student schedules in early August.)

The link below provides you access to a letter mailed to student homes on July 16 and it contains a draft of the daily bell schedule for the 4x4 system, as well as the attendance schedule for the first three weeks of the school year.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JCRWj3M28QRva_0sTp-dXBE6PdL13nvEEfBp7JO4sgc/edit?usp=sharing

Please remember that all plans are subject to change if our guidance from the State changes.

Much more information and details to follow. Thank you!

post_text: YEARBOOKS: Many have been inquiring about the yearbooks. The publisher has notified us that they are planning on shipping them to us in mid-July. They were in complete production shutdown for ten weeks due to COVID. We will contact families that have pre-purchased yearbooks when they arrive to arrange pickup/delivery. Thank you. We appreciate your patience.

post_text:
Good Morning Lake Region Seniors! One week to go until the graduation parade. I am looking forward to seeing you all in person once again...diplomas are signed and waiting to be distributed. Be sure to take care of cleaning up the last bit of work in those required classes in the next few days.

A reminder that the best place for updated graduation info will be the school website. We will distribute a handout at the fairgrounds on Sunday with a diagram and more specific directions for the drive-thru portion of getting your diploma.

Mr. Earle has finished the "Front Porch" photos of the seniors. Check out his Facebook page to see his wonderful work. THANK YOU, OLD ONE!!! So giving and so very much appreciated by everyone!

Have a great week, be safe, and see you all on Sunday!
Mr. Mess

Mr. Earle has finished the "Front Porch" photos of the seniors. Check out his Facebook page to see his wonderful work. THANK YOU, OLD ONE!!! So giving and so very much appreciated by everyone!

Mr. Mess

post_text:
And for the 8th time in the last 9 years, we are recognized by the US News & World Report.

It’s official!: Lake Region Union High School is a 2020 Best High School, based on rankings that U.S. News & World Report published this morning. Here is your school’s updated U.S. News profile page, with its new ranking(s): https://www.usnews.com/education/best-high-schools/vermont/districts/lake-region-uhsd-24/lake-region-union-high-school-20299.

Congratulations, Team!!!!!

post_text: We are sad to inform the LR student body that the 2020 Prom has been cancelled and will not be rescheduled due to the difficulties of coordinating all of the necessary vendors for such an event. Our hope is that the 2021 Prom will be bigger and better than ever. #RollRangers

post_text:
SCHOLARSHIP QUESTION: Several people have inquired about the scholarships traditionally awarded at graduation. Over $100,000 in local scholarship money is generally awarded at the LRUHS graduation ceremony. The scholarship packets submitted by the seniors have been distributed to all of the local groups and organizations who select the recipients for their respective scholarships. We anticipate that these organizations will continue to make these awards at our graduation ceremony as normal.

IF there is no graduation ceremony, the Lake Region guidance department will work with the organizations to facilitate the distribution of the awards, either by providing addresses and contact information to the donors so that they can reach out to the individual awardees of their respective scholarships or by sending awards to the students directly from the guidance office.

post_text: 2020 YEARBOOKS: Great news on this front. The LR Yearbook crew (Mrs. Mess, Braydon, Hunter, Joel, Jack, Jordyn, Lily & Brooke) FINISHED the yearbook on the last day before the closure and got it submitted to the publishers. Note: The publisher is currently shut down for the time-being, but our yearbook is near the top of their que for production because of when it was submitted. Awesome work Team!! #RollRangers
